project.teaser: PARC is an EU-wide research and innovation partnership programme to support EU and national chemical risk assessment and risk management bodies with new data, knowledge, methods, networks and skills to address current, emerging and novel chemical safety challenges. PARC will...
project.objective: PARC is an EU-wide research and innovation partnership programme to support EU and national chemical risk assessment and risk management bodies with new data, knowledge, methods, networks and skills to address current, emerging and novel chemical safety challenges. PARC will facilitate the transition to next generation risk assessment to better protect human health and the environment, in line with the Green Deal?s zero-pollution ambition for a toxic free environment and will be an enabler for the future EU ?Chemicals Strategy for Sustainability?. It builds in part on the work undertaken and experience acquired in past and on-going research and innovation actions, but goes beyond by its vocation to establish an EU-wide risk assessment hub of excellence. To contribute to several expected impacts of destination 2 ?Living and working in a health-promoting environment?, PARC will organise the activities to reach three specific objectives: - An EU-wide sustainable cross-disciplinary network to identify and agree on research and innovation needs and to support research uptake into regulatory chemical risk assessment. - Joint EU research and innovation activities responding to identified priorities in support of current regulatory risk assessment processes for chemical substances and to emerging challenges. - Strengthening existing capacities and building new transdisciplinary platforms to support chemical risk assessment. The Partnership brings together Ministries and national public health and risk assessment agencies, as well as research organisations and academia from almost all of EU Member States. Representatives of Directorates-General of the EC and EU agencies involved in the monitoring of chemicals and the assessment of risks are also participating. PARC will meet the needs of risk assessment agencies to better anticipate emerging risks and respond to the challenges and priorities of the new European policies.
project.title: Partnership for the Assessment of Risks from Chemicals

article.title: Two maps and a knowledge hub to minimise risks to human health and the environment
article.teaser: Three valuable tools are now available to promote next-generation risk assessment.

result.title: Report on the conceptual design and development guidelines of the PARC EWS
result.description: Report on the conceptual design and development guidelines of the PARC EWS - leader: SLU (AE of SEPA)This report will describe the conceptual design configuration of the early warning system envisaged in PARC coupling computational with analytical approaches to allow for integrative early warning regarding signals of the emergence of chemicals of concern in the environment and consumer and food products. The report will serve as the blueprint for the development of the system providing operational guidelines and user requirements translated into system requirements.

details.authors: """Cecilia Askhama,⁎, Valentina H. Pauna a,b, Anne-Marie Boulay c, Peter Fantke d, Olivier Jolliet d, Jérôme Lavoie e, Andy M. Booth f, Claire Coutris g, Francesca Verones h, MiriamWeber i, Martina G. Vijver j, Amy Lusher k,l, Carla Hajjar c"""

result.title: 1st Mapping of Needs report
result.description: This deliverables will describe the first exercise that will be perform to identify priorities for PARC from partners but also from third parties (as users of PARC results). These priorities will reflect the information needs of policy makers at both EU and national levels with regards to human and environmental exposure to chemicals and resulting health impacts. This will be done by engaging with the scientific community, regulatory entities and key stakeholders and harvesting their needs through surveys, workshops and documents that will specify regulatory needs and what activities and processes are necessary to achieve these objectives.

result.title: Report on the conceptual design of the SSbD toolbox
result.description: Report on the conceptual design of the SSbD toolbox This report will describe the conceptual design configuration of the SSbD toolbox, covering all aspects of the SSbD process and criteria for SSbD chemicals and materials. This document will be the blueprint for the further development of the SSbD toolbox. It will result from extended consultation with the relevant stakeholders and will ensure the full compliance with the SSbD criteria developed by the European Commission. The SSbD toolbox design will ensure that tools developed outside of PARC can be readily integrated into the toolbox.

result.title: Rapid Response Report
result.description: In order to respond to new and urgent needs for information in the EU policy community and at national level, a rapid response mechanism will allow policy makers to submit requests for specific information. This deliverable will describe the process put in place in PARC to answer to these urgent needs and illustrate with first request if there is already one. These information requests may require new surveys on particular chemicals or in particular geographical regions (respecting the scope of countries included in PARC consortium).

result.title: Optimised list of indicators
result.description: Optimised list of indicators - leader: DOMG (AE of VITO)A monitoring and evaluation framework was already prepared, previous to PARC submission, including a long list of key performance indicators. It was used as basis for the PSIPS and KPI table (see First Biennial Monitoring Report for European Partnerships). This initial set of indicators will be further developed and optimised to prepare an optimised list of indicators for upcoming years. This will be done in collaboration with the MB, GSB and the GB, NHs and stakeholders, to ensure its relevance for evaluating the progress of the Partnership’s key, useful and impactful results. The list will include baselines and clear targets and will feed into the annual ASR reporting. A revised list will be produced on month 40 to be used within the mid-term review.

result.title: Catalogues on environmental and biomonitoring networks Y1
result.description: The catalogues will gather under a common umbrella information on (bio)monitoring networks existing in the various risk assessment domains at national and European levels, related (meta)data, and sample collections. Catalogues on air monitoring networks, HBM, and articles will be built first and it is expected that pilot catalogues on air monitoring networks and HBM will be available within the first year of PARC. The catalogues will be regularly updated, initially assumed on an annual basis.

result.description: Description of the activities to be implemented during year 1 , including the updated rolling SRIA with projects that are in the planning/executive phase

result.title: Prioritisation criteria report
result.description: This deliverable will describe the criteria that will be used to rank the priorities (either for substances or groups of substances and methods) identified following the mapping of needs together with the targeted activities under the WPs. It will also document the process that has been used to agree on these criteria among PARC partners. The criteria might be related to hazardous properties of the substance/group and/or exposure and /or risk, either for human health or for the environment. For methods, the deliverable will develop criteria to identify the areas for which new methods and other innovative tools should be developed or standardised or pre-validated.

result.title: 1st New approach methodologies report
result.description: 1st New approach methodologies reportThis report will summarize results from 5.2 on the endpoints ED, (D)NT, NGtx-carc, immunotox, metabolic disruption. The report will give details on the developed NAMs and on the follow-up action to be taken to make the methods robust enough that regulators accept the results. Additionally scientific achievements (publications, oral presentations etc.), presentations of the NAMs to regulators.

result.title: ASR Y1
result.description: Summary of the action, implemented activities and achievements during Y1

result.title: PARCroute roadmap1
result.description: "Interim report on the work on the roadmap for the transition of the major European chemical regulation programs towards NGRA (""NGRAroute"")"

result.title: Laboratory catalogue and network platform (dashboard) Y1
result.description: The catalogue and network platform will gather and provide information and contacts on the existing laboratory capacities and networks within HBM and environmental monitoring under a common architecture. They will serve as a roadmap for users and stakeholders searching resources and capacities needed for next generation risk assessment. The catalogues and information provided there will be gradually built to finally encompass all the relevant risk assessment domains and updated (initially assuming) on an biannual basis.
